element.name: 29 A Walk in the Garden-Fancy/Knocknacloghogh by Kili or bust, Multi-cache (1.5/3.5)
element.long-description:
Visit The Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
In spring of youth it was my lot
To haunt of the wide world a spot
The which I could not love the less-
So lovely was the loneliness
Of a wild lake, with black rock bound,
And the tall pines that towered around.
But when the Night had thrown her pall
Upon that spot, as upon all,
And the mystic wind went by
Murmuring in melody-
Then- ah then I would awake
To the terror of the lone lake.
Yet that terror was not fright,
But a tremulous delight-
A feeling not the jewelled mine
Could teach or bribe me to define-
Nor Love- although the Love were thine.
Death was in that poisonous wave,
And in its gulf a fitting grave
For him who thence could solace bring
To his lone imagining-
Whose solitary soul could make
An Eden of that dim lake.
(Edgar Allan Poe)
For me, this is one of the most visually stunning walks in the Garden series. It is approx 11K in length with a total ascent of about 850m if you follow the hike as described in the illustration above. Naturally there are other ways to reach the cache but I simply wanted to indicate one of the most rewarding walks you could do in the beautiful Garden County and take in a few caches on the way. The three and a half stars for terrain reflects the route in the illustration above. It would be much less otherwise.
It is a walk of two lakes and two mountains with much to see along the way. From both summits, and from Knocknacloghogh in particular, on a clear day you can see just about every summit in the Wicklow mountains. You can meet large herds of deer both on the mountains and in the grazing fields below. I preferred to do the hike in an anti-clockwise direction and though the haul up to Fancy (Luggala) is long, the second mountain is much easier. This cache is placed in the pretty and often suntrapped valley between the two. I placed it, near to the babbling brook, on the date of a significant birthday where a group and I celebrated with a cake and a large bottle of bubbly in glorious March sunshine!
Stage 1 is at the Pier Gates at N53 05.785 W006 15.072 where you will find a sign. Under the "Private Road" in the English section count the words in the first short paragraph and call this number "X"
The position of the final cache is as follows: N53 05.(X times 37)+7 W006 17.27 times X
From Mountain Views:
Luggala Mountain
Log an Lá A name in Irish (Ir. Log an Lá [logainm.ie], 'hollow of the [obscure element]') Height: 595 metres OS 1/50k Mapsheet: 56 for top Grid Ref: O15012 07402 Latitude: 53.105085 Longitude: -6.283495 ITM: 714935 707434 Prominence: 110m Isolation: 2.1km Rating graphic. Also known as Fancy, from Ir. Fuinnse [PNCW], 'ash-tree', and Cloghoge. Price's interpretation of this name as Log an Lágh, 'hollow of the hill', is doubtful. There is no evidence in dictionaries for the existence of a word lágh with this meaning. The second element does not appear to be lá, 'day', either. Luggala is the 286th highest summit in Ireland.
Knocknacloghoge Mountain Wicklow County Cnoc na Chlochóg A name in Irish (prob. Ir. Cnoc na Clochóige [PDT], 'hill of the stony land') Height: 534 metres OS 1/50k Mapsheet: 56 for top Grid Ref: O14357 05442 Latitude: 53.087622 Longitude: -6.293966 ITM: 714281 705474 Prominence: 129m Isolation: 2.1km Rating graphic. Possibly identical with the hill named as The Dalty or Foolya by Price [PNCW]. Knocknacloghoge is the 386th highest summit in Ireland.
Do not start the trek without all the proper mountain rain gear, waterproof boots and the guidance material, compass, map, GPSr with mapping etc.
Please note that all parts of this cache are hiked at your own risk. The cache owner takes no responsibility of any sort for any reason including accidents or mishaps.
Please be aware that cars parked in areas close to walking trails are vulnerable and they can be vandalised or stolen. Unfortunately this is an ongoing problem which is extremely difficult to solve, so there is a risk involved.
Please observe the country code to the best of your ability. Local landowners often generously allow access to upland areas across or through parts of their private property. Please, please be conscious of this and return the courtesy by keeping all gates closed, immediately and not on your way back!. Please use the gates where appropriate but if you have to climb over them then use the hinged side ONLY.
Please do not cause any damage of any sort to fences or barriers along the way.

ul.li:
2010-04-10T19:00:00Z : Found it by Jumpin Jiminie
Finished work at 1 so decided to head for the hills and see if I could pick this one up.
It really was the perfect day for such a stunning walk....just me and the hundreds of deer that graze in the area. I didn't realise it was still unfound until I got to gz and had to unwrap a shiny new log book!
I was hoping that the owner may have left some of that bubbly but sadly I had to settle for some of my own Tipperary Spring water instead [:)]
Thanks for another great cache and a belated happy birthday Sean!
Jamie

wpt.name: GCRT3J
wpt.desc: 29 A Walk in the Garden-Fancy/Knocknacloghogh by Kili or bust, Multi-cache (1.5/3.5)

In spring of youth it was my lot
To haunt of the wide world a spot
The which I could not love the less-
So lovely was the loneliness
Of a wild lake, with black rock bound,
And the tall pines that towered around.

But when the Night had thrown her pall
Upon that spot, as upon all,
And the mystic wind went by
Murmuring in melody-

To the terror of the lone lake.

Yet that terror was not fright,
But a tremulous delight-
A feeling not the jewelled mine
Could teach or bribe me to define-
Nor Love- although the Love were thine.

Death was in that poisonous wave,
And in its gulf a fitting grave
For him who thence could solace bring
To his lone imagining-
Whose solitary soul could make
An Eden of that dim lake.
(Edgar Allan Poe)

Do not start the trek without all the proper mountain rain gear, waterproof boots and the guidance material, compass, map, GPSr with mapping etc.

Please note that all parts of this cache are hiked at your own risk. The cache owner takes no responsibility of any sort for any reason including accidents or mishaps.


Please be aware that cars parked in areas close to walking trails are vulnerable and they can be vandalised or stolen. Unfortunately this is an ongoing problem which is extremely difficult to solve, so there is a risk involved.

Please observe the country code to the best of your ability. Local landowners often generously allow access to upland areas across or through parts of their private property. Please, please be conscious of this and return the courtesy by keeping all gates closed, immediately and not on your way back!. Please use the gates where appropriate but if you have to climb over them then use the hinged side ONLY.
Please do not cause any damage of any sort to fences or barriers along the way.


Additional Waypoints

PKRT3J - Garden 29 Parking
N 53째 06.145 W 006째 15.265
